meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be induced.
meanings.sent1: Her inducibilities made her a perfect candidate for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the inducibilities of different materials.
meanings.sent3: The inducibilities of the puppy to play fetch were unmatched.
meanings.sent4: His inducibilities to laughter were like a contagious virus spreading through the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's inducibilities to learn were inspiring to all her students.

meanings.definition: The ability to be influenced or persuaded.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement appealed to the consumer's inducibilities to buy the product.
meanings.sent2: She was cautious of her own inducibilities to peer pressure.
meanings.sent3: His inducibilities to try the new food were met with skepticism from his friends.
meanings.sent4: The politician's inducibilities to win the election were evident in his passionate speeches.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotist's inducibilities over the audience were mesmerizing to watch.
